content.description: A model showing the cells in anaphase <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and anaphase <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of meiosis during a nondisjunction event is shown in Figure 1.
content.question: Figure 1. Model of a nondisjunction event Which of the following best predicts the effect of the chromosomal segregation error shown in Figure 1?

choices.label: All of the resulting gametes will have an extra chromosome.
All of the resulting gametes will be missing a chromosome.
Half of the resulting gametes will have an extra chromosome and the other half will be missing a chromosome.
Half of the resulting gametes will have the correct number of chromosomes, and the other half will have an incorrect number of chromosomes.

content.answer: Half of the resulting gametes will have the correct number of chromosomes, and the other half will have an incorrect number of chromosomes.
